text: Life Sentence  Vent When I witnessed my mother attempt suicide  I can remember a poignant conversation I had with my Dad   He asked me where she did it  and his reaction to my response has resonated with me since   Almost proudly  I professed that she did so in front of me  Any explanation or words of comfort were absent in the face of the fact that my childhood was over  I was too young to appreciate the gravity of what I had witnessed  and instead rather perversely resumed playing with my teddies and toys   Upon reflecting on this experience  I feel neglected by those who were meant to nurture me  Although witnessing a suicide attempt at the age of eight is undoubtedly harrowing   just as it wasn t the end of my mother s life   it did not have to be the end of my mine
summary: At the age of 8, my mother tried to commit suicide in front of her daughter. She was too young to appreciate the gravity of what she had witnessed and instead she played with her toys. She feels neglected by those who were meant to nurture her.

text: On The Edge and Contemplating DeathI want to cry  but I just can t thanks to my depression  I want to find enjoyment and distractions in the things I used to do before  but it all seems hollow and empty  I m facing the howling void  perched on the precipice of oblivion  and I m considering taking that final step and hoping something better   or at least nothingness if anything else   awaits beyond this life A quick rundown  I m getting divorced  my wife of six years is leaving me  I have severe depression and anxiety  I have a young son who I barely see thanks to this  only once a week for a few hours at a time  I had a mental breakdown when she told me she was going to leave me and got hospitalized  She wants nothing to do with me  My soulmate is gone  Worse  all of this is my fault  All of it I m lonely  I m scared  I m exhausted  I m sad  I m nervous  I m lost  and I m ashamed  I could have fixed this but I failed  and now I ve lost it all  I m subconsciously seeking death  I think   not caring for myself  eating badly  drowning in my own sorrow  I just wonder if it wouldn t be more prudent to just end it  rather than hope I die in my sleep from an aneurysm or get hit by a massive truck while driving
summary: On the edge of oblivion, depressed and lonely, thinking about suicide. His wife of six years is leaving him. He has a young son who he sees only once a week for a few hours at a time. He had a mental breakdown when she told him she was going to leave him.
cleaned: edge oblivion depressed lonely thinking suicide wife year leave young son see week hour time mental breakdown tell go leave

text: Depression is worse  constant suicidal thoughts This year has been extremely difficult for me  Not a lot pf things have gone well and I feel extremely confused and like most people only speak to me as connivence  Since I have been told I am a good listener  I am run down and my motivation for anything has been at a zero  Im not proud of my art or writing I anymore after some things that have happened I have always had depression and anxiety   Professionally diagnosed  At a young age my parents took me out of treatment because they felt nothing was working and I was faking it  Im a lot calmer now  but my suicidal thoughts are worse  I want to get help but I cannot afford it  and I don t think I can ask family for any support because they don t really get how I am feeling and seem irritated when I talk to them about this Lately I have isolated myself  I don t want to talk ti my friends about this because I feel will drain them emotionally if I do  I also am afraid to be thrown somewhere forcefully for  help  if I tell people  Really  nothing makes me happy  Im disappointed in myself and my lack of emotional strength  I have been contemplating suicide everyday after the whirlwind this year has been   though I have not actively made a plan  Things scare me about it but the emotional pain has been far worse
summary: This year has been difficult for me. I have always had depression and anxiety. My parents took me out of treatment when I was a young age. Now I'm calmer but my suicidal thoughts are worse. I want to get help but I can't afford it. I don't want to talk to my friends about it as it will drain them emotionally.
cleaned: year difficult depression anxiety parent take treatment young age calm suicidal thought bad want help not afford not want talk friend drain emotionally

text: I wrote a poem about m depression please be nice it s my first oneSome people say they ve had it tough  Well As a kid I would often look rough  For My mother was a useless junkie Too hooked to get off the stuff She Ruined me and my brother  Destroyed the future we had  And for that I hate you mother  You ve made me really mad My head now spins with thoughts  Most of them aren t very nice  And all of this could end  With one faithful slice  But although my head is fucked  And I can t see the light  There s always another way  You just need to fight
summary: As a kid, my mother was a junkie. She ruined the future for me and my brother and made me mad. Now, I'm depressed and I can't see the light, but there's always another way to get better.
